name: The Westin Bellevue Dresden

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is perfect for all that want to have the great view to the skyline of Dresden. Book your rooms accordingly and do not mind the mark up for higher levels. The skyline is lighted up until around midnight. The walk over the bridge at day time is very short and you can take a good photo of the scenery.
reviews.title: A great view from the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately the breakfast in the hotel is very average. It seems like there is a lot of hungry people in the hotel.
reviews.title: A hotel with a view

reviews.text: Service is very friendly.
reviews.title: Everyone needs to visit Dresden - well kept secret

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Westin is a good hotel with a beautiful over the old city of Dresden. Check in was easy and even though our flight arrived early in the morning a room was available. We had a superior room with a beautiful view of the old city. Rooms were quit, comfortable and spacious. Beds were adequate. Internet was not free which is a minus and should be in a hotel this class. Service is ok and buffet breakfast was included in the weekend rate which was good value.
reviews.title: If only the air conditioning was sorted out

reviews.text: The Westin Bellevue is in a great location by the River Elbe with fantastic views of the city. Its just a short stroll across one of the lovely bridges and you're in the town. The hotel is large and grand in a modern way. Upmarket bar and resturant with lovely terraces with views of the garden and river. Definately recommend the hotel - it has a swimming pool, nice sized rooms, fantastic breakfast. Staff on reception really friendly, helpful on arrival, gave us tips of where to go, map etc. Dresden is a hidden gem - cobbled streets, lovely old buildings, great bars/resturants. Really recommend drinks on the roof terrace of the Yenidze (an old tobacco company in the style of a mosque) which gives you sweeping views of the city. We took a trip by train to Coldiz Castle POW camp - if you're doing this do the official tour - takes 2 hrs - absolutely fascinating. Also 4 hour boat trip up the River Elbe (fantastic views - if you're doing this - get on boat early to ensure outside seat). Really recommend the Westin and Dresden. Enjoy your trip.
reviews.title: Issues with check-in

reviews.text: Westin Bellevue has a great location and clean and comfortable room. Its rate is also reasonable compared with some other hotels in this area. My room was in the 1st floor and was air conditioned just right. Internet and breakfast are very expensive but included in my rate package for free. The breakfast is wonderful and the hotel service is generally very good. There's no clock in my room but not a big problem.
reviews.title: generally good experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Things I didn't quite like are:
reviews.title: Yes please, a room with a view .....

reviews.text: 1. The telephone charge is surprisingly high. I didn't find any info about pricing of local phone calls in the hotel's brochure in my room and made some phone calls to local mobile numbers. It turned out later that the rate was surprisingly high. And the hotel's service desk even don't know how the charge was calculated exactly but only saying the rate varies from mobile carrier to carrier on the receiving end. For example, I had to pay 14.4 euro for a 4 min call to a local mobile number. So be careful!
reviews.title: HVAC off for energy saving, otherwise fantastic

reviews.text: 2. I'm from the US and I paid my bill with a Mastercard. The hotel clerk asked me whether to pay by euro or US$. I asked if there's any service charge if I chose US$ and she said no. It turned out that there's a "3.5% markup" against the charge according to the receipt. And it is actually ~4% from my calculation from the latest rate. I know many creditors charge ~3% for transactions in foreign currencies and Mastercard charges another ~1% or so. But my Capital One card waives the 3% fee. So I lost the 3% for nothing. All in all, be aware that it's very possible that choosing "paying by US$" won't save you anything.
reviews.title: Dresden, and its Westin Hotel, is a wonderful surprise

reviews.text: We came on here directly from the WESTIN GRAND in Berlin & were delightfully welcomed at reception & offered on payment of a supplement a 4th floor room ( 412 ) with a " Canaletto " view. The Grand De Luxe room was very little different from what is described as simple (?) De Luxe in Berlin, but nonetheless comfortably appointed & the view imprenable. The only disadvantage was the connecting door with the next room, an arrangement which hotels fondly pretend is soundproof but never is.
reviews.title: Clean, Comfortable, Beatifull Views, Good Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Westin Bellevue is wonderfully located by the Elbe River right at the place where Canaletto painted his "Dresden from the right bank of the Elbe below the Augustus Bridge" painting. So if you have a room on the river side (which is more expensive) you will have a fantastic views of the city. It is just a short walk across a bridges and you're in the city center, right at the Semper Oper and other monuments. The hotel has a swimming pool, and nice bar and restaurant. But what really makes it unforgettable is a fantastic breakfast with wide selection of cold and warm dishes, fruit, cakes etc. - so make sure it is included in your room rate.
reviews.title: Unforgettable breakfast

reviews.text: As a regular SPG/WESTIN client the WESTIN Dresden has been a shock for me, an unexpected one. Knowing the stylish WESTINs in Frankfurt and Munich you would never expect such an old, worn, run down property under the WESTIN flag.
reviews.title: Back to the GDR/DDR

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel was built during the sozialist time - and it can be seen. The tasteless and cold lobby with worn out sofas, the terrible bathroom with the plastic bath tub, the very tastless and worn furniture in the room as well as the smell... SHOCKING!!!
reviews.title: Great view from across the river

reviews.text: In addition the service is far from 5*, e.g. there was nobody to park my car/take my luggage when I arrived. When I arrived at the reception two receptionists were free - but both couldn't check me in since they were "busy".
reviews.title: Great hotel in a perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another joke is the "free water" for Platinum SPG guests, there's just a bottle a charge of € 5,90. When I asked for the free bottle I've been informed that the € 5,90 bottle is free for me... How should you know this when there's nothing written???
reviews.title: Elegant hotel, relaxing and helpful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel a few days before Christmas, in the middle of one of the snowiest Decembers on record in Europe. It was a short stay, only one night, but wonderful nevertheless. From the moment we checked everything worked out well. The woman at the front desk was exceptionally polite and helpful, from recommending where to eat, what the hotel offers, helping with map directions, to telling us about all the other Christmas markets in town (besides the Striezelmarkt). I have preferred status at Westins so we stayed on a nice quiet floor with an amazing view. The view was a free upgrade and while unexpected, quite a nice surprise. From our large room we saw across the river to old town (beautiful buildings) and it was beyond picturesque with the architecture, partially frozen river and glistening snow. Also we had the chance to get breakfast on Sunday morning, 2 people for the price of one. There was quite a spread of wonderful morning goodies. All around I would highly recommend the hotel. If you do travel in winter though notice that there are multiple temp controls in the room. We missed this after returning from our afternoon on the town, didn't realize that the control on the wall was simply for air, even with temp adjustment possibilities. The radiator on the wall was the way to get warm but we did not discover this till early next morning when I opened the curtains. Not a huge problem certainly but one that would have made tv watching before climbing into bed more pleasant.
reviews.title: Well situated, wonderfully staffed

reviews.text: Day trip from Berlin. Booked this online thru Starwood. Nice follow up from the concierge to a special request. Convenient via public transportation, Very clean, nice linens. Beautiful views along the river across to historic Dresden. Easy walk to town and nearby restaurants and shopping. Did not use any services or amenities but also did not need to ask for anything after check in.
reviews.title: Convenient, very clean, good service, reliable Westin brand

reviews.text: stopped at Dresden Westin Bellevue while en route to Augsburg. Very clean hotel with excellent service, clean rooms, welcoming staff. Ask for the rooms that overview the river Elbe, very similar to Budapest with the river side illuminated by night. Probably much nicer in the warm weather but Dresden still charming despite the cold.
reviews.title: charming hotel by the river elbe in dresden

reviews.text: Had breakfast both days of my stay with adequate choices, newspaper, etc.
reviews.title: Great hotel, but have to cross the river for the interesting part of Dresden

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bathroom not cramped, towels impeccable. Location 5 minutes from central areas in Allstadt.
reviews.title: Not only beautiful view

aka: The Westin Bellevue Dresden Hotel Dresden
description: In the heart of the city, surrounded by picturesque gardens along the banks of the river Elbe, The Westin Bellevue presents Dresden’s famous “Canaletto view“ of the baroque city centre’s skyline. The Church of Our Lady, the Semper Opera house and the Green Vault are only a footwalk over the bridge away. Enjoy the young part from Dresden, Dresden Neustadt awaits you with restaurants, bars and cafés. Start your day right with our Super Foods breakfast at our restaurant Palais with terrace. Refresh your senses in the spacious wellness area” Bell´Acqua Spa” with pool, sauna, solarium and fitness area.Eat well at our restaurant Canaletto. The chef Marko Poike-Wenzel will take you on a culinary journey through the German cuisine with Mediterranean influences. The Café-Bar „Pöppelmann“ combines the charm of a coffeehouse with the atmosphere of an elegant bar and welcomes you for lunch, coffee specialties or a cocktail. During the summertime you enjoy your drinks at the baroque courtyard with Italian flair. Cool down in our beergarden “Elbsegler”. Comfortable furniture next to barbecue specialities and a cold beer provide the perfect place to feel good and relax.
